register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the SW supervised clock domain state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L3_GCLK clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is active
Corresponding clock is gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the DLL_AGING_GCLK clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is active
Corresponding clock is gated

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the L3 clock domain.

bitenum.description: SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.

register.description: This register manages the L3 Interconnect clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is fully functional, including OCP

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.
Module is disable by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock

bitenum.description: Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.
Module is disable by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

bitenum.description: SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.

register.description: This register manages the L4LS clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is fully functional, including OCP

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.
Module is disable by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

bitenum.description: Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.
Module is disable by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

register.description: This register manages the GPIO1 clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is fully functional, including OCP

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is enabled
Optional functional clock is disabled

register.description: This register enables the clock domain state transition. It controls the SW supervised clock domain state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the EMIF PHY clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is active
Corresponding clock is gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the DLL clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is active
Corresponding clock is gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the EMIF L3 clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is active
Corresponding clock is gated

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the ICSS OCP clock domain.

bitenum.description: SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.

register.description: This register manages the EMIF clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is fully functional, including OCP

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.
Module is disable by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

register.description: This register manages the DLL clock.

bitfield.description: Optional functional clock control.

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is enabled. DLL_CLK is garantied to not be gated if already running.
Optional functional clock is disabled. DLL_CLK can be gated when EMIF domain performs sleep transition

register.description: This register enables the clock domain state transition. It controls the SW supervised clock domain state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the LCD clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is active
Corresponding clock is gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the LCDC L3 OCP clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is active
Corresponding clock is gated

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the LCDC OCP clock domain.

bitenum.description: SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.

register.description: This register enables the clock domain state transition. It controls the SW supervised clock domain state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the DSS L3 OCP clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is active
Corresponding clock is gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the DSS SYSCLK clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is active
Corresponding clock is gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the DSS CLK clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is active
Corresponding clock is gated

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the DSS OCP clock domain.

bitenum.description: SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.

register.description: This register manages the DSS clocks.

bitfield.description: Module standby status.

bitenum.description: Module is in standby
Module is functional (not in standby)

bitfield.description: Module idle status.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is active
Corresponding clock is gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the CPSW_50MHZ_GCLK clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is active
Corresponding clock is gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the CPSW_250MHZ_GCLK clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is active
Corresponding clock is gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the CLKACTIVITY_CPTS_RFT_GCLK clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is active
Corresponding clock is gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the CPSW 125 MHz OCP clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is active
Corresponding clock is gated

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the CPSW OCP clock domain.

bitenum.description: SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.

register.description: This register manages the CPSW clocks.

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [[br]]This bit is warm reset insensitive when CPSW RESET_ISO is enabled

bitenum.description: Module is in standby
Module is functional (not in standby)

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [[br]]This bit is warm reset insensitive when CPSW RESET_ISO is enabled

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is fully functional, including OCP

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed. [[br]]This bit is warm reset insensitive when CPSW RESET_ISO is enabled

bitenum.description: Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.
Module is disable by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the SW supervised clock domain state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the OCPWP L3 clock in the domain.
Controls the clock state transition of the OCPWP clock domain.

bitenum.description: SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.

register.description: This register manages the OCPWP clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is fully functional, including OCP

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.
Module is disable by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).
